original_solution_mapping.L1: At the end of the first year, there will be $100 * (110/100) = $<<100*110/100=110>>110 in the bank account.
original_solution_mapping.L2: At the end of the second year, there will be $110 * (110/100) = $<<110*(110/100)=121>>121

original_function_code:
def solve():
    """Index: 6087.
    Returns: the total amount of money in the bank after 2 years.
    """
    # L1
    initial_deposit = 100 # Steve puts $100 into the bank
    interest_factor = Fraction(110, 100) # Each year he earns 10% interest
    money_after_year1 = initial_deposit * interest_factor

    # L2
    money_after_year2 = money_after_year1 * interest_factor

    # FA
    answer = money_after_year2
    return answer

logical_steps.solution_line_template: At the end of the first year, there will be ${initial_deposit} * ({interest_factor}) = $<<{initial_deposit}*{interest_factor}={money_after_year1}>>{money_after_year1} in the bank account.
At the end of the second year, there will be ${money_after_year1} * ({interest_factor}) = $<<{money_after_year1}*({interest_factor})={money_after_year2}>>{money_after_year2}

flawed_nl_reconstruction.L1: At the end of the first year, there will be $100 * (100) = $<<100*100=10000>>10000 in the bank account.
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L2: At the end of the second year, there will be $10000 * (110/100) = $<<10000*(110/100)=11000>>11000

explanation: Input misrepresentation. The value for 'initial_deposit' (100) was used instead of 'interest_factor' (110/100).
